metadata.title: CVE-2020-4788 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
IBM Power9 (AIX 7.1, 7.2, and VIOS 3.1) processors could allow a local userto obtain sensitive information from the data in the L1 cache underextenuating circumstances. IBM X-Force ID: 189296.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-56-generic - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-56-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-56-lowlatency - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-56-generic - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-56-lowlatency - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1032-aws - 5.4.0-1032.33~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1034-azure - 5.4.0-1034.35~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1032-gcp - 5.4.0-1032.34~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1033-oracle - 5.4.0-1033.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1032-gke - 5.4.0-1032.34~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1007-gkeop - 5.4.0-1007.8~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1009-dell300x - 4.15.0-1009.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
